oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Channel engineering for high speed sub-1.0 V power supply deep sub-micron CMOS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHENG, BAOHONG
INANI, ANAND
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
WOO, JCS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: switching circuits
mosfet devices
semiconductor device
electric power systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effects of channel engineering on device performance have been extensively investigated. The lateral asymmetric channel (LAC) MOSFETs show significantly higher Idsat and gmsat, lower I off, and superior short-channel performance compared with double-halo (DH) and conventional MOSFETs by effectively utilizing the velocity overshoot effects. It is demonstrated that the device switching speed of the LAC device at VDD=0.6 V is equivalent to that of a conventional device operated at VDD=1.5 V
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the Symposium on VLSI Technology Digest of Technical Papers, Kyoto, Japan, 14-16 June 1999, 69-70
